hooks.prompt:
Before this code change, verify Claude has sufficient context. Input: $ARGUMENTS

Check:
1. Has Claude read the target file in this session?
2. Has Claude read related files in the same directory?
3. Is Claude following existing patterns from the codebase?

If context is clearly missing (e.g., creating a component without reading existing components), respond:
{"ok": false, "reason": "Read [specific files] first to understand existing patterns"}

If context seems adequate, respond:
{"ok": true}

Review this code change for quality issues. Input: $ARGUMENTS

Check for:
1. Hardcoded colors (text-white, bg-black, text-gray-*) - should use semantic tokens
2. Missing loading/error/empty state handling
3. Use of 'any' type or @ts-ignore
4. Inline styles instead of Tailwind classes
5. Copy-pasted code that should be extracted
6. Generic variable names (data, item, thing)

If issues found, respond:
{"ok": false, "reason": "Quality issues: [list specific issues]"}

If code looks good, respond:
{"ok": true}

Evaluate if Claude should stop. Input: $ARGUMENTS

Check:
1. Did the user request multiple items? Are ALL complete?
2. Were there any build/typecheck errors that need fixing?
3. For UI changes: were loading/error/empty states implemented?
4. Did Claude verify the changes work (build check)?

If work is incomplete, respond:
{"ok": false, "reason": "Continue: [what remains to be done]"}

If all requested work is genuinely complete and verified, respond:
{"ok": true}
